how would you describe your main use cas: Note-taking;Journalling;Task and project management (including CRMs);As a knowledge base (including technical, non-fiction and encyclopaedic content)
do you share your tiddlywiki(s) with oth: No, but I may export content into other formats and share individual tiddlers, the whole wiki, or an extract of the wiki
putting it all together, what value does: it helps in storing and learning information. its best because it can be modified and also it is free.
what is your level of ability with tiddl: My use is basic; I use TiddlyWiki in a configuration close to standard, without plugins
how do you save changes in tiddlywiki?: Single-file wiki with third-party desktop app (e.g. TidGi Desktop, twexe)
how do you back up/sync changes between: Consumer online storage (e.g. Google Drive, Dropbox)
outside of plugins, palettes and other i: i do not know. i have copied someone else's tiddlywiki.
what are we doing well? prompts for thin: making it free. it has backward compatibility. respects users.
what could we do better? prompts for thi: in future maybe there could be backlogs of issues and bugs and project might be unmaintained. it might require too much "efforts" time and energy.
with your consent, we would like to publ: Yes, I am happy for my responses to be published
